model.ds_dbt.cio_customer_event.description: Table containing Cio customer events, e.g. user_unsubscribe.

email_id.name: email_id
email_id.description: Unique message id (each individual message sent from Customer.io has a different "email_id"); can also be found in the unsubscribe link URL

customer_id.name: customer_id
customer_id.description: user id (can be retrieved from the person profile). Only present if the person is still active (not included if the person has been deleted).

template_id.name: template_id
template_id.description: internal attribute, each email inside a campaign can have multiple template ids depending on the changes made over time. You can view it in the UI by filtering for a specific email under Email Log. For example: https://fly.customer.io/env/51831/email_logs?campaign=139744&template=343216

event_id.name: event_id
event_id.description: internal attribute; id associated with the email_type action

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.description: date and time when the event took place in unix (seconds since epoch) format

cio_campaign_id.name: cio_campaign_id
cio_campaign_id.description: refer to the transactional, segment-triggered or newsletter campaign that generated the email

cio_campaign_name.name: cio_campaign_name
cio_campaign_name.description: refer to the transactional, segment-triggered or newsletter campaign that generated the email

cio_message_id.name: cio_message_id
cio_message_id.description: campaign email id; can be found in the campaign URL after emails/ (e.g. https://fly.customer.io/env/51831/v2/composer/emails/225039)

cio_message_name.name: cio_message_name
cio_message_name.description: the name of the campaign email

model.ds_dbt.cio_customer_event.compiled_sql:
SELECT
    COALESCE(
        event #>>'{data, email_id}',
        event #>>'{data, variables, email_id}'
    ) AS email_id,
    event #>>'{data, customer_id}' AS customer_id,
    event #>>'{data, email_address}' AS email_address,
    CAST(
        event #>>'{data, template_id}' AS INTEGER
    ) AS template_id,
    event ->> 'event_id' AS event_id,
    TO_TIMESTAMP(
        CAST(event ->> 'timestamp' AS INTEGER)
    ) AS "timestamp",
    event ->> 'event_type' AS event_type,
    event #>>'{data, variables, campaign, id}' AS cio_campaign_id,
    event #>>'{data, variables, campaign, name}' AS cio_campaign_name,
    event #>>'{data, variables, campaign, type}' AS cio_campaign_type,
    event #>>'{data, message_id}' as cio_message_id,
    event #>>'{data, message_name}' as cio_message_name
FROM
    "quasar_prod_warehouse"."cio"."event_log" cel
WHERE
    event ->> 'event_type' IN ('customer_subscribed', 'customer_unsubscribed')
UNION

WHERE
    -- Date we re-started saving raw C.io events to the event_log table
    "timestamp" < '2020-04-01'

model.ds_dbt.device_northstar.raw_sql:
--All Device ID - Northstar ID Combinations
WITH devices_all AS (
    SELECT device_id, northstar_id
    FROM {{ ref('phoenix_events_combined') }}
    GROUP BY device_id, northstar_id
),
--Devices purely Anonymous (Remove Devices ever associated with NSIDs)
--If a DeviceID was both logged-in and logged-out, it will be removed from the anonymous DeviceID pool
devices_an AS (
    SELECT device_id
    FROM devices_all
    WHERE northstar_id is NULL
    EXCEPT
    SELECT device_id
    FROM devices_all
    WHERE northstar_id IS NOT NULL
),
-- All ND IDs assocaited with DS (to exclude them next)
ds AS (
    SELECT northstar_id
    FROM {{ ref('users') }}
    WHERE lower(email) LIKE '%@dosomething.org'
    GROUP BY northstar_id
),
--Devices owned by NSIDs (DS removed)
devices_ns AS (
    SELECT da.device_id, da.northstar_id
    FROM devices_all da
    LEFT JOIN ds ON (da.northstar_id=ds.northstar_id)
    WHERE da.northstar_id IS NOT NULL
    AND ds.northstar_id is NULL
)
SELECT device_id, northstar_id
FROM devices_ns
UNION ALL
SELECT device_id, NULL
FROM devices_an
model.ds_dbt.device_northstar.name: device_northstar
model.ds_dbt.device_northstar.description: Get a list of User ID's mapped to Device ID's

northstar_id.name: northstar_id
northstar_id.description: The Northstar ID of the user who generated the event.

test.ds_dbt.relationships_distinct_snowp.name: relationships_distinct_snowplow_base_event_northstar_id__northstar_id__ref_users_
test.ds_dbt.relationships_distinct_snowp.compiled_sql:
SELECT
        count(DISTINCT a.northstar_id) AS orphan_ids
    FROM
        "quasar_prod_warehouse"."public"."snowplow_base_event" a
        LEFT JOIN "quasar_prod_warehouse"."public"."users" b ON a.northstar_id = b.northstar_id
    WHERE
        a.northstar_id IS NOT NULL
        AND b.northstar_id IS NULL

macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__list_relati.name: postgres__list_relations_without_caching
macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__list_relati.macro_sql:
{% macro postgres__list_relations_without_caching(schema_relation) %}
  {% call statement('list_relations_without_caching', fetch_result=True) -%}
    select
      '{{ schema_relation.database }}' as database,
      tablename as name,
      schemaname as schema,
      'table' as type
    from pg_tables
    where schemaname ilike '{{ schema_relation.schema }}'
    union all
    select
      '{{ schema_relation.database }}' as database,
      viewname as name,
      schemaname as schema,
      'view' as type
    from pg_views
    where schemaname ilike '{{ schema_relation.schema }}'
  {% endcall %}
  {{ return(load_result('list_relations_without_caching').table) }}
{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__get_catalog.name: postgres__get_catalog
macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__get_catalog.macro_sql:
{% macro postgres__get_catalog(information_schema, schemas) -%}

  {%- call statement('catalog', fetch_result=True) -%}
    {#
      If the user has multiple databases set and the first one is wrong, this will fail.
      But we won't fail in the case where there are multiple quoting-difference-only dbs, which is better.
    #}
    {% set database = information_schema.database %}
    {{ adapter.verify_database(database) }}

    select
        '{{ database }}' as table_database,
        sch.nspname as table_schema,
        tbl.relname as table_name,
        case tbl.relkind
            when 'v' then 'VIEW'
            else 'BASE TABLE'
        end as table_type,
        tbl_desc.description as table_comment,
        col.attname as column_name,
        col.attnum as column_index,
        pg_catalog.format_type(col.atttypid, col.atttypmod) as column_type,
        col_desc.description as column_comment,
        pg_get_userbyid(tbl.relowner) as table_owner

    from pg_catalog.pg_namespace sch
    join pg_catalog.pg_class tbl on tbl.relnamespace = sch.oid
    join pg_catalog.pg_attribute col on col.attrelid = tbl.oid
    left outer join pg_catalog.pg_description tbl_desc on (tbl_desc.objoid = tbl.oid and tbl_desc.objsubid = 0)
    left outer join pg_catalog.pg_description col_desc on (col_desc.objoid = tbl.oid and col_desc.objsubid = col.attnum)

    where (
        {%- for schema in schemas -%}
          upper(sch.nspname) = upper('{{ schema }}'){%- if not loop.last %} or {% endif -%}
        {%- endfor -%}
      )
      and not pg_is_other_temp_schema(sch.oid) -- not a temporary schema belonging to another session
      and tbl.relpersistence = 'p' -- [p]ermanent table. Other values are [u]nlogged table, [t]emporary table
      and tbl.relkind in ('r', 'v', 'f', 'p') -- o[r]dinary table, [v]iew, [f]oreign table, [p]artitioned table. Other values are [i]ndex, [S]equence, [c]omposite type, [t]OAST table, [m]aterialized view
      and col.attnum > 0 -- negative numbers are used for system columns such as oid
      and not col.attisdropped -- column as not been dropped

    order by
        sch.nspname,
        tbl.relname,
        col.attnum

  {%- endcall -%}

  {{ return(load_result('catalog').table) }}

{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt_postgres.postgres_get_relation.name: postgres_get_relations
macro.dbt_postgres.postgres_get_relation.macro_sql:
{% macro postgres_get_relations () -%}

  {#
      -- in pg_depend, objid is the dependent, refobjid is the referenced object
      --  > a pg_depend entry indicates that the referenced object cannot be
      --  > dropped without also dropping the dependent object.
  #}

  {%- call statement('relations', fetch_result=True) -%}
    with relation as (
        select
            pg_rewrite.ev_class as class,
            pg_rewrite.oid as id
        from pg_rewrite
    ),
    class as (
        select
            oid as id,
            relname as name,
            relnamespace as schema,
            relkind as kind
        from pg_class
    ),
    dependency as (
        select
            pg_depend.objid as id,
            pg_depend.refobjid as ref
        from pg_depend
    ),
    schema as (
        select
            pg_namespace.oid as id,
            pg_namespace.nspname as name
        from pg_namespace
        where nspname != 'information_schema' and nspname not like 'pg\_%'
    ),
    referenced as (
        select
            relation.id AS id,
            referenced_class.name ,
            referenced_class.schema ,
            referenced_class.kind
        from relation
        join class as referenced_class on relation.class=referenced_class.id
        where referenced_class.kind in ('r', 'v')
    ),
    relationships as (
        select
            referenced.name as referenced_name,
            referenced.schema as referenced_schema_id,
            dependent_class.name as dependent_name,
            dependent_class.schema as dependent_schema_id,
            referenced.kind as kind
        from referenced
        join dependency on referenced.id=dependency.id
        join class as dependent_class on dependency.ref=dependent_class.id
        where
            (referenced.name != dependent_class.name or
             referenced.schema != dependent_class.schema)
    )

    select
        referenced_schema.name as referenced_schema,
        relationships.referenced_name as referenced_name,
        dependent_schema.name as dependent_schema,
        relationships.dependent_name as dependent_name
    from relationships
    join schema as dependent_schema on relationships.dependent_schema_id=dependent_schema.id
    join schema as referenced_schema on relationships.referenced_schema_id=referenced_schema.id
    group by referenced_schema, referenced_name, dependent_schema, dependent_name
    order by referenced_schema, referenced_name, dependent_schema, dependent_name;

  {%- endcall -%}

  {{ return(load_result('relations').table) }}
{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.name: default__snapshot_merge_sql
macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.macro_sql:
{% macro default__snapshot_merge_sql(target, source, insert_cols) -%}
    {%- set insert_cols_csv = insert_cols | join(', ') -%}

    merge into {{ target }} as DBT_INTERNAL_DEST
    using {{ source }} as DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE
    on DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_scd_id = DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_scd_id

    when matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_valid_to is null
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type = 'update'
        then update
        set dbt_valid_to = DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_valid_to

    when not matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type = 'insert'
        then insert ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
        values ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
    ;
{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt.strategy_dispatch.name: strategy_dispatch

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_hash_argumen.name: default__snapshot_hash_arguments

macro.dbt.snapshot_timestamp_strategy.name: snapshot_timestamp_strategy

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_string_as_ti.name: default__snapshot_string_as_time

macro.dbt.snapshot_check_all_get_existin.name: snapshot_check_all_get_existing_columns

macro.dbt.snapshot_check_strategy.name: snapshot_check_strategy

macro.dbt.default__create_columns.name: default__create_columns

macro.dbt.snapshot_staging_table.name: snapshot_staging_table
macro.dbt.snapshot_staging_table.macro_sql:
{% macro snapshot_staging_table(strategy, source_sql, target_relation) -%}

    with snapshot_query as (

        {{ source_sql }}

    ),

    snapshotted_data as (

        select *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key

        from {{ target_relation }}

    ),

    insertions_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            nullif({{ strategy.updated_at }}, {{ strategy.updated_at }}) as dbt_valid_to,
            {{ strategy.scd_id }} as dbt_scd_id

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    updates_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_to

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    insertions as (

        select
            'insert' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*

        from insertions_source_data as source_data
        left outer join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is null
           or (
                snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is not null
            and snapshotted_data.dbt_valid_to is null
            and (
                {{ strategy.row_changed }}
            )
        )

    ),

    updates as (

        select
            'update' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id

        from updates_source_data as source_data
        join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where snapshotted_data.dbt_valid_to is null
        and (
            {{ strategy.row_changed }}
        )
    )

    select * from insertions
    union all
    select * from updates

{%- endmacro %}

ds_dbt.block_id.name: block_id
ds_dbt.block_id.block_contents: References specific content blocks from contentful CMS, PMs decide whether its important to send that info with specific click events.

ds_dbt.context_source.name: context_source
ds_dbt.context_source.block_contents:
We use this to denote the 'context' for events that can be triggered from different locations in the app. (It'll be a string like campaign_landing_page or scholarship_modal).

e.g. the 'clicked_signup' event can come from wherever we embed a campaign signup form which happens in a modal, or on the landing page itself. (So helpful for analytics to determine which specific form is driving the signup).

ds_dbt.context_value.name: context_value
ds_dbt.context_value.block_contents: This property is available to add more context to certain events (e.g. cause value selected when filtering campaigns by cause). It is vague enough that testing of when we should get this value is not practical. Consult with PMs for specific context when this field exists.

ds_dbt.group_id.name: group_id
ds_dbt.group_id.block_contents:
Unique identifier for groups. Group id is tied to work for volunteer credits and online voter drives (members can participate as part of a group)... product managers can choose to send web events with the group_id where its relevant. (right now it's being used for Online voter registration groups, but in the future it could be used for other types of group related efforts, e.g. volunteer hours).

Included only with "clicked_group_finder_group" events. This may change in the future. Consult with PMs for use of this property in other events.

ds_dbt.search_query.name: search_query
ds_dbt.search_query.block_contents: Term associated with any search events. Sent when the user submits a search term in the search bar.

ds_dbt.click_id.name: click_id
ds_dbt.click_id.block_contents: This is a unique identifier for each click

ds_dbt.target_url.name: target_url
ds_dbt.target_url.block_contents: URL where the user will be directed

ds_dbt.broadcast_id.name: broadcast_id
ds_dbt.broadcast_id.block_contents: ID of the broadcast that generated the shortened URL

ds_dbt.source.name: source
ds_dbt.source.block_contents: Source of the URL (e.g. SMS, web), origin of the post (e.g. phoenix-web, phoenix-ashes, sms), or source where user was acquired. (e.g. sms, phoenix-next)

ds_dbt.post_source_buckets.name: post_source_buckets
ds_dbt.post_source_buckets.block_contents: Aggregated list of the grouping buckets for the origin of the posts (e.g. sms, web)

ds_dbt.post_types.name: post_types
ds_dbt.post_types.block_contents: Aggregated list of post types of the posts (e.g. photo, phone-call, share-social, text, voter-reg, email)

ds_dbt.campaign_post_types.name: campaign_post_types
ds_dbt.campaign_post_types.block_contents: Aggregated list of post types of all the actions available for the campaign (e.g. photo, phone-call, share-social, text, voter-reg, email)

ds_dbt.interaction_type.name: interaction_type
ds_dbt.interaction_type.block_contents: How the user interacted with the link (e.g. preview, click)

ds_dbt.quantity.name: quantity
ds_dbt.quantity.block_contents: Numerical quantity of items specified in the call to action (e.g. 10, 200)

ds_dbt.source_bucket.name: source_bucket
ds_dbt.source_bucket.block_contents: Grouping bucket for the origin of the post (e.g. web, sms)

ds_dbt.created_at.name: created_at
ds_dbt.created_at.block_contents: When the item was created in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.updated_at.name: updated_at
ds_dbt.updated_at.block_contents: When the item was updated in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.text.name: text
ds_dbt.text.block_contents: Text of the post (e.g. "Zoo animals and a super hero trying to help too!")

ds_dbt.post_class.name: post_class
ds_dbt.post_class.block_contents: Class of the signup (e.g. "photo - default", "phone-call - DefendDreamers_Jan16_BothBodies")

ds_dbt.is_accepted.name: is_accepted
ds_dbt.is_accepted.block_contents: Whether the post has been accepted to be displayed to the public on the website

ds_dbt.location.name: location
ds_dbt.location.block_contents: Location where the action takes place (e.g. US-NY)

ds_dbt.postal_code.name: postal_code
ds_dbt.postal_code.block_contents: Postal code where the action takes place

ds_dbt.is_reportback.name: is_reportback
ds_dbt.is_reportback.block_contents: Whether the post is a reportback. The application allows for multiple types of posts.

ds_dbt.civic_action.name: civic_action
ds_dbt.civic_action.block_contents: Whether the post is a Civic Action. The application allows for multiple types of posts.

ds_dbt.scholarship_entry.name: scholarship_entry
ds_dbt.scholarship_entry.block_contents: Whether the post is a Scholarship Entry. The application allows for multiple types of posts.

ds_dbt.why_participated.name: why_participated
ds_dbt.why_participated.block_contents: Why the user participated in this action. Entered by the user.

ds_dbt.details.name: details
ds_dbt.details.block_contents: Details about the post. Contains contentfulId and other information (e.g. {"campaignContentfulId":"6ATBgGEQEeJoIcxs1qbwaC"})

ds_dbt.source_details.name: source_details
ds_dbt.source_details.block_contents: Details about the source of the item. This is sometimes represented as a JSON object, and for other tables like Turbovote its represented as a string. (e.g. "{"contentful_id":"3CTLlXfbwtz1FOMpl31SKV","utm_source":"scholarship_listing","utm_medium":"referral","utm_campaign":"fastweb_2019_08"}", newsletter_456)

ds_dbt.campaign_id.name: campaign_id
ds_dbt.campaign_id.block_contents: This is a unique identifier for the campaign

ds_dbt.internal_campaign_id.name: internal_campaign_id
ds_dbt.internal_campaign_id.block_contents: Internal DoSomething Campaign ID. Not present on all web visits (ex. the homepage is not tied to a campaign_id).

ds_dbt.campaign_run_id.name: campaign_run_id
ds_dbt.campaign_run_id.block_contents: Unique identifier for the campaign run

ds_dbt.campaign_run_start_date.name: campaign_run_start_date
ds_dbt.campaign_run_start_date.block_contents: Start date of the campaign run

ds_dbt.campaign_run_end_date.name: campaign_run_end_date
ds_dbt.campaign_run_end_date.block_contents: End date of the campaign run

ds_dbt.campaign_created_date.name: campaign_created_date
ds_dbt.campaign_created_date.block_contents: When the campaign was created in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.campaign_node_id.name: campaign_node_id
ds_dbt.campaign_node_id.block_contents: Internal unique node id for the campaign

ds_dbt.campaign_action_type.name: campaign_action_type
ds_dbt.campaign_action_type.block_contents: Campaign action type (eg. Make Something, Share Something)

ds_dbt.post_action_types.name: post_action_types
ds_dbt.post_action_types.block_contents: Aggregated list of Action Types of the Posts (e.g. attend-event, share-something, make-something, collect-something, contact-decisionmaker, donate-something, host-event, have-a-conversation, flag-content, sign-petition, submit-tip, other)

ds_dbt.campaign_action_types.name: campaign_action_types
ds_dbt.campaign_action_types.block_contents: Aggregated list of Action Types of all the Actions available for the campaign (e.g. attend-event, share-something, make-something, collect-something, contact-decisionmaker, donate-something, host-event, have-a-conversation, flag-content, sign-petition, submit-tip, other)

ds_dbt.campaign_cause_type.name: campaign_cause_type
ds_dbt.campaign_cause_type.block_contents: Campaign cause type (e.g. Mental Health, Education, Environment)

ds_dbt.campaign_noun.name: campaign_noun
ds_dbt.campaign_noun.block_contents: Noun applicable to the user's action

ds_dbt.campaign_verb.name: campaign_verb
ds_dbt.campaign_verb.block_contents: Verb describing the action the user should take

ds_dbt.campaign_language.name: campaign_language
ds_dbt.campaign_language.block_contents: "Language in which the campaign is available"

ds_dbt.agent_id.name: agent_id
ds_dbt.agent_id.block_contents: If set, the content type of the picture the member is sending us. Exp. image/png.

ds_dbt.attachment_content_type.name: attachment_content_type
ds_dbt.attachment_content_type.block_contents: If set, the handle of the Front agent this outbound support message is from.

ds_dbt.topic.name: topic
ds_dbt.topic.block_contents: Holds a reference to the **last** campaign topic the member's conversation was in. This is useful to allow members to talk to Gambit and get quick responses (through Rivescript), without Gambit completely forgetting what state the member's interaction with a campaign topic was in.

ds_dbt.action_serial_id.name: action_serial_id
ds_dbt.action_serial_id.block_contents: Serial id for the user's action. Depends on the source of the action. May be the bertly click id, sms message id, etc.

ds_dbt.channel.name: channel
ds_dbt.channel.block_contents: Channel for the user's action. Depends on the source of the action. (e.g. web, sms)

ds_dbt.first_action_month.name: first_action_month
ds_dbt.first_action_month.block_contents: Month during which the user took their first action.

ds_dbt.event_id.name: event_id
ds_dbt.event_id.block_contents: This is a unique identifier for each event

ds_dbt.event_source.name: event_source
ds_dbt.event_source.block_contents: Application source for event (eg. Phoenix, Northstar)

ds_dbt.event_datetime.name: event_datetime
ds_dbt.event_datetime.block_contents: When the event occurred in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.event_type.name: event_type
ds_dbt.event_type.block_contents: Type of event (pv = 'Page View', se = 'Structured Event')

ds_dbt.host.name: host
ds_dbt.host.block_contents: URL host where event occurred (eg. www.dosomething.org or identity.dosomething.org)

ds_dbt.path.name: path
ds_dbt.path.block_contents: URL path event occurred at (eg. /login or /us/campaigns/huddle-for-heroes)

ds_dbt.query_parameters.name: query_parameters
ds_dbt.query_parameters.block_contents: Optional query parameters for the request (eg. query=huddle)

ds_dbt.se_category.name: se_category
ds_dbt.se_category.block_contents: Category of event (eg. focused_field, authentication) - Snowplow Custom structured event. (Required for event type "se")

ds_dbt.se_action.name: se_action
ds_dbt.se_action.block_contents: Action performed / event name (eg. form_submitted, action_failed) - Snowplow Custom structured event. (Required for event type "se")

ds_dbt.se_label.name: se_label
ds_dbt.se_label.block_contents: The object of the action (eg. first_name, register, voter_reg_status) - Snowplow Custom structured event. (Required for event type "se")

ds_dbt.session_id.name: session_id
ds_dbt.session_id.block_contents: Unique identifier of the user's session. This is how we associate all events in a visit.

ds_dbt.session_counter.name: session_counter
ds_dbt.session_counter.block_contents: How many sessions a user has started. This is how we associate new vs. returning visits.

ds_dbt.browser_size.name: browser_size
ds_dbt.browser_size.block_contents: Which type of browser a user is using (eg. Mobile, Desktop). This is default metadata sent from browser, it won't always be present.

ds_dbt.northstar_id.name: northstar_id
ds_dbt.northstar_id.block_contents: The Northstar ID of the user who generated the event.

ds_dbt.referrer_host.name: referrer_host
ds_dbt.referrer_host.block_contents: URL host of the referring site (eg. google.com). Only present if session is referred from some external site link (ex. Facebook, Google, Bing). This would be NULL for anyone directly typing dosomething.org into a browser

ds_dbt.referrer_path.name: referrer_path
ds_dbt.referrer_path.block_contents: URL path from referring site (eg. /10-stats-on-teen-drug-and-alcohol-use/). Only present if session is referred from some external site link (ex. Facebook, Google, Bing).

ds_dbt.referrer_source.name: referrer_source
ds_dbt.referrer_source.block_contents: Referrer source name (eg. Google, Facebook). Only present if session is referred from some external site link (ex. Facebook, Google, Bing).

ds_dbt.utm_source.name: utm_source
ds_dbt.utm_source.block_contents: Tracks where the traffic is coming from. (eg. scholarship_listing, Facebook). Parameter passed by marketing team (would not be present for organic/ direct traffic)

ds_dbt.utm_medium.name: utm_medium
ds_dbt.utm_medium.block_contents: How the traffic got to the platform (eg. referral, CPC). Parameter passed by marketing team (would not be present for organic/ direct traffic)

ds_dbt.utm_campaign.name: utm_campaign
ds_dbt.utm_campaign.block_contents: Tracks which campaign the traffic was generated by. Shows up in Google Analytics as Campaign Name (eg. editorial_newsletter). Parameter passed by marketing team (would not be present for organic/ direct traffic)

ds_dbt.click_event_url.name: click_event_url
ds_dbt.click_event_url.block_contents: This "url" is included in some events. Not all events with a name containing "clicked" will have "url" included. Consult with PMs for context specific to a certain event.

ds_dbt.modal_type.name: modal_type
ds_dbt.modal_type.block_contents: Certain pages have modals and therefore certain event actions will have it (e.g. NULL or SURVEY_MODAL). Included with "opened_modal" or "closed_modal" events.

ds_dbt.landing_datetime.name: landing_datetime
ds_dbt.landing_datetime.block_contents: Timestamp of when the session started, in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.ending_datetime.name: ending_datetime
ds_dbt.ending_datetime.block_contents: Timestamp of when the session ended, in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.num_pages_viewed.name: num_pages_viewed
ds_dbt.num_pages_viewed.block_contents: Number of view events in this session.

ds_dbt.landing_page.name: landing_page
ds_dbt.landing_page.block_contents: First page the user viewed in the session (eg. /us/facts/11-facts-about-bp-oil-spill)

ds_dbt.exit_page.name: exit_page
ds_dbt.exit_page.block_contents: Which page the user ended or exited their session from (eg. /us/campaigns/green-your-getaway)

ds_dbt.noun.name: noun
ds_dbt.noun.block_contents: Noun that corresponds to the item in the call to action that was delivered. (e.g. drawings, tweets)

ds_dbt.verb.name: verb
ds_dbt.verb.block_contents: Verb corresponding to the action the user took. (e.g. shared, sent, taken)

ds_dbt.deleted_at.name: deleted_at
ds_dbt.deleted_at.block_contents: Date time in UTC when a user deleted their post.

ds_dbt._fivetran_deleted.name: _fivetran_deleted
ds_dbt._fivetran_deleted.block_contents: Marks rows that were deleted in the source table

ds_dbt._fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
ds_dbt._fivetran_synced.block_contents: (UTC timestamp) keeps track of when each row was last successfully synced

ds_dbt.reportback.name: reportback
ds_dbt.reportback.block_contents: Whether the post is a reportback

ds_dbt.anonymous.name: anonymous
ds_dbt.anonymous.block_contents: Whether the user is anonymous when making the post

ds_dbt.callpower_campaign_id.name: callpower_campaign_id
ds_dbt.callpower_campaign_id.block_contents: Unique ID corresponding to the Callpower campaign. Callpower allows users to record messages for their representatives.

ds_dbt.quiz.name: quiz
ds_dbt.quiz.block_contents: Whether the post is a quiz

ds_dbt.action_type.name: action_type
ds_dbt.action_type.block_contents: Type of action the user took. (e.g. share-something, donate-something)

ds_dbt.online.name: online
ds_dbt.online.block_contents: Whether the action is a online as opposed to IRL.

ds_dbt.post_online_offline.name: post_online_offline
ds_dbt.post_online_offline.block_contents: Aggregate. Whether the posts are online, offline (IRL), or both, e.g. ("Online", "Offline", "Online , Offline")

ds_dbt.time_commitment.name: time_commitment
ds_dbt.time_commitment.block_contents: Estimated time required to do the action (e.g. 3.0+, <0.5)

ds_dbt.most_recent_signup.name: most_recent_signup
ds_dbt.most_recent_signup.block_contents: Timestamp of the most recent signup in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.num_rbs.name: num_rbs
ds_dbt.num_rbs.block_contents: Quantity of reportbacks for the user

ds_dbt.total_quantity.name: total_quantity
ds_dbt.total_quantity.block_contents: Total quantity of items in reportbacks

ds_dbt.most_recent_rb.name: most_recent_rb
ds_dbt.most_recent_rb.block_contents: When the most recent reportback occurred in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.first_rb.name: first_rb
ds_dbt.first_rb.block_contents: When the first reportback occurred in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.avg_days_next_action_after_rb.name: avg_days_next_action_after_rb
ds_dbt.avg_days_next_action_after_rb.block_contents: Calculated average days until next action after reportback

ds_dbt.days_to_next_action_after_last_rb.name: days_to_next_action_after_last_rb
ds_dbt.days_to_next_action_after_last_rb.block_contents: This is a unique identifier for each event

ds_dbt.most_recent_mam_action.name: most_recent_mam_action
ds_dbt.most_recent_mam_action.block_contents: Most recent monthly active member qualifying action in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00).

ds_dbt.most_recent_email_open.name: most_recent_email_open
ds_dbt.most_recent_email_open.block_contents: Most recent email open in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.most_recent_all_actions.name: most_recent_all_actions
ds_dbt.most_recent_all_actions.block_contents: Most recent timestamp of any action in UTC (eg. 2018-01-01 12:00:00)

ds_dbt.last_action_is_rb.name: last_action_is_rb
ds_dbt.last_action_is_rb.block_contents: Whether the last action the user took was a reportback

ds_dbt.days_since_last_action.name: days_since_last_action
ds_dbt.days_since_last_action.block_contents: Days since the user's last action

ds_dbt.time_to_first_rb.name: time_to_first_rb
ds_dbt.time_to_first_rb.block_contents: How much time after registering until the user's first reportback

ds_dbt.sms_unsubscribed_at.name: sms_unsubscribed_at
ds_dbt.sms_unsubscribed_at.block_contents: Timestamp of when user unsubscribed from SMS messaging

ds_dbt.user_unsubscribed_at.name: user_unsubscribed_at
ds_dbt.user_unsubscribed_at.block_contents: Timestamp of when user unsubscribed from email or sms

ds_dbt.voter_reg_acquisition.name: voter_reg_acquisition
ds_dbt.voter_reg_acquisition.block_contents: Whether the user was an acquisition through voter registration efforts.

ds_dbt.last_logged_in.name: last_logged_in
ds_dbt.last_logged_in.block_contents: Date time in UTC when user last logged in to Northstar

ds_dbt.last_accessed.name: last_accessed
ds_dbt.last_accessed.block_contents: Date time in UTC when user last access the website

ds_dbt.last_messaged_at.name: last_messaged_at
ds_dbt.last_messaged_at.block_contents: Date time in UTC when user was last sent a message via SMS or email

ds_dbt.voter_registration_status.name: voter_registration_status
ds_dbt.voter_registration_status.block_contents: User's registration status. (e.g. registration_complete, confirmed, uncertain)

ds_dbt.finish_with_state.name: finish_with_state
ds_dbt.finish_with_state.block_contents: If the registrant was eligible to use and passed through to complete their registration with their state’s OVR system, it will be indicated in this field (direct quote from Rock-The-Vote documentation). Yes/No value in field.

ds_dbt.reportback_volume.name: reportback_volume
ds_dbt.reportback_volume.block_contents: This field returns 1 if non voter-reg action, since campaigns team only counts those a 1 reportback. If voter-reg action, we want to count quantity of post as number of registered voters.

ds_dbt.address_street_1.name: address_street_1
ds_dbt.address_street_1.block_contents: First line of user's street address

ds_dbt.address_street_2.name: address_street_2
ds_dbt.address_street_2.block_contents: Second line of user's street address

ds_dbt.cio_status.name: cio_status
ds_dbt.cio_status.block_contents: Status of user from CIO. (e.g. customer_subscribed, customer_unsubscribed)

ds_dbt.cio_status_timestamp.name: cio_status_timestamp
ds_dbt.cio_status_timestamp.block_contents: Timestamp when users's status was updated.

ds_dbt.source_detail.name: source_detail
ds_dbt.source_detail.block_contents: Details of the origin of the user. (e.g. tell_a_friend, other, opt_in_path/197981)

ds_dbt.badges.name: badges
ds_dbt.badges.block_contents: Whether the user has any badges.

ds_dbt.refer_friends.name: refer_friends
ds_dbt.refer_friends.block_contents: Whether the user is a part of the refer a friend campaign.

ds_dbt.school_id.name: school_id
ds_dbt.school_id.block_contents: Unique identifier for the user's school. This info comes from the school finder.

ds_dbt.user_agent.name: user_agent
ds_dbt.user_agent.block_contents: Full user agent string for a user's browser (e.g. "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux i686; rv:24.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/24.0")

ds_dbt.campaigns.name: campaigns

Date corresponding to the start of the period analyzing how newsletter subscription status contributes to campaign sign-up

Context: Period start and end are simply the start and end of the month. In a previous iteration of the model, some periods were 5-months long which is why these fields are not called months.

dbt.__overview__.name: __overview__
dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--models` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

---

### More information

- [What is dbt](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/overview)?
- Read the [dbt viewpoint](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/viewpoint)
- [Installation](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/installation)
- Join the [chat](https://community.getdbt.com/) on Slack for live questions and support.
